alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 1:21PM AKST until December 17 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and gusty winds will develop this afternoon ahead of a front advancing toward the coast. Snow will become heavier Saturday night as the front moves to the coast. Gusty northeasterly winds will become southeast and eventually southwest as the front moves through the region Sunday morning. Snow will taper off as the front lifts north with winds slowly diminishing through Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
